Instruction: Rehydrate the Wakame: In a large bowl, combine the dried wakame seaweed with the water. Let it soak for 10-15 minutes, or until the seaweed is rehydrated and softened. The wakame will expand significantly as it absorbs water.
Drain the seaweed in a colander and rinse it briefly with cold water. Squeeze out any excess water using your hands or a clean kitchen towel.
Optional: If using, thinly slice the cucumber, carrots, red onion, and scallions.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and sugar. Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add the rehydrated wakame seaweed to the dressing and toss to coat evenly.
Optional: Add the sliced cucumber, carrots, red onion, and scallions (if using) to the bowl and toss to combine.
Sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds over the salad.
Taste the salad and adjust seasonings with additional soy sauce, rice vinegar, or sugar as desired.
Serve the seaweed salad chilled. It's a refreshing side dish or light lunch option.
